column11: What have been the positive features of this module up to this point?
column12: Were there any negative features of this module up to this point? What aspects of the module might be improved?

column11: I think logic is very mentally demanding which is great, as it promotes active thinking and develops our understanding of arguments
column12: No negative features
column13: Seminar leader is great, clearly explains everything and is always open for questions

column11: The seminar leader is able to effectively and clearly explain difficult concepts using simple and concise language.
column12: The class is held too early in the day for my liking and sometimes the classroom is maybe too big for everyone to be able to see the board.
column13: The seminar leader is friendly and responsive to inquiry.

column11: Hugo has explained any questions thoroughly, helping to build my understanding of logic.
column12: N/A

column11: Clear explanations
The seminars have been really great to actually understand how to solve the exercises
column12: It’s perfect

column11: The quality of the teaching, the content and the structure of formative assessments.
The module does a great job of slowly building and introducing logic, it feels very natural without feeling sluggish or too rapid.
column12: The connection to using logic in scenarios like developing an argument isn’t that strong.

column11: The learning atmosphere feels really good and I feel that it helps straighten out things I was confused with in the lecture.
column12: I wish we had more discussions with the people around us so we could connect with people in the seminar and find it easier to make friends in the course.

column11: Hugo Heagren teaches logic extremely well: he takes time to answer all questions, and he clearly likes the subject.
Thanks to this seminar, I was able to better understand the lectures, thank you!
Really interesting and made me want to take a logic module in second year!
Well taught and well explained
column12: Might need to spend longer on natural deduction, especially the rules and the specifics of them

column11: always available to answer questions, and making sure what is explained is clear to everyone
column12: none

column11: The consistency of lectures and seminars, I.e how it was taught. The lecturer’s/seminar leader’s friendliness with the class.
column12: More simplified explanations/resources for logic. Genuinely struggled with this topic and was unprepared to deal with it. Managed to overcome it but wish I was aware of it sooner and had a more “baby-steps” approach to the content.

column11: A clear step by step approach that makes it easy to keep track of what we are learning.
column12: A clear cheat-sheet provided with the simple breakdown of all the rules.

column11: It’s been interesting to learn a new language altogether, that is also counterintuitive to traditional forms of languages, but also seeing how they interact and synergise to help make clearer arguments or evaluate them
column12: My only issue is that 1hr seems to be too short. especially for the technical classes like Semantics and Natural Deductions, there is only time to go through basic problems. E.g., the lecture does not cover everything and it would be nice if this can be carried on in the seminar (ND: Negation and biconditional rules were barely gone over)
column13: Nil. Thanks sm Hugo. Best seminar teacher in my time here at King’s (By FAR!!!) :)))))

column11: Teachers are active and professional
column12: Reflection of weekly exercise and guidance, but it’s hard to achieve because of the limited time

column11: The module encourages critical thinking rather than passive learning.
column12: I haven't encountered any negative features.

column11: My seminar leader has been very good at being clear and clarifying things that I didn't fully understand in the lecture. It was especially helpful going through examples in the seminars.
Our seminar leader explained things very well to us because lectures sometimes were confusing.
column12: Sometimes confusing lectures

column11: the seminar leader encouraged us to ask questions without judgment
column12: some concepts were explained a bit too briefly
Lack of ability to attend any office hours as they clash with other tutorials, though presumably out of tutorial leaders control

column11: I think the seminars were very effective at smoothing out any misunderstandings of the content.
Interesting, debate, engaging
column12: Confusing, we are a lot of people in the seminar

column11: The examples explained board have helped me understand logic a lot better
column12: Sometimes I find the lectures a little confusing as the multitude of examples and the pace of the lecture

column11: Learning a new language and developing new thinking skills to approach logic problems in a different method, learning about truth tables and proofs was interesting.
column12: There’s a lot of reliance of halbachs manual, and there’s not much resources that follow gentzen notation. There should be more resources provided, especially for natural deduction. Carrs natural deduction pack is helpful, if there could be more it would be great.
column13: Time management of the seminar and finishing content, sometimes as a class we get carried away with other questions that aren’t as relevant to the content we’re covering

column11: The seminar leader is very responsive to student questions
column12: It’s still the start of the module so I didn’t see any flaws

column11: Good explanations and clear responses to questions
column12: especially with details not presented in the readings like motivation for studying and why we build up to what we are working towards
column13: Office hours clash with my other classes

column11: Lecturer is very engaging. Maintains good class engagement and is generally fun to learn from
column12: None

column11:
- Stimulates intellectual curiosity 
- Good thinking practice
column12: N/a

column11: The module is a good way to rethink thinking (AKC!) and atleast reconsider the manner in which one communicates or engages in discourse.
column12: Gentzen natural deduction is difficult, and we should do Fitch instead. There should be an extra week dedicated to Nat. Ded.
column13: Hugo is a great teacher but is overly charitable to students who ask obvious, unneeded question. The class would be more effectively led if the advice given to some students was "This has already been covered, refer to the lecture slides or come to office hours if you still have an issue"

column11: This module has been extremely interesting. I have learnt a lot from it. It's been intellectually stimulating. I have really enjoyed studying Logic. I am now considering studying Logic in the future as a result of this module. I wasn't expecting to enjoy Logic so much! These seminars have been well-taught. Hugo has been very good at explaining very complicated topics in an comprehensible manner.
The teacher is conscientious and responsible, and carefully corrects my assignments.
column12: No.

column11: Very interesting, seminar leader shows impeccable reasoning and understanding of the subject
column12: Material in week 4 “natural deduction” significantly more difficult than the rest of the course, potentially focus more on this part of the course.

column11: It helped me thinking and reasoning more deeply about language and sparked in me an interest in Logic.
column12: Maybe more lessons focused on difficult topics like Natural deduction.

column11: it was nice to have logic classes in philosophy

The content has been explained well to me. I like the weekly online exercises and think they have helped a lot and have provided good explanations for incorrect answers. I also appreciate the past papers and online materials which not many other modules have.
column12: This isn’t related to seminars but at times the lecture is really hard to comprehend when the content itself is not that difficult. I think some of the content, and especially the examples provided during the lecture, could be communicated in a more concise manner.
column13: Often times people are talking and coughing in the lecture hall and it’s really hard to understand what’s being said but I think this isn’t an issue native to the module itself.

column11: Hugo is excellent, and clearly always tries his hardest, to make sure that students understand the material, and that they feel more informed after having their questions answered.
column12: The negative features revolve around the difficultly to intuit the material, not anything that Hugo has done.

column11: hugo is very good at explaining the concepts in an easy to grasp way and always has time to listen in office hours. he also continually highlights that it is a safe space to say if you don’t understand without being made to feel stupid.
column12: giving too much time to unrelated questions (ones that aren’t related at all to what we are doing) instead of directing them to office hours resulting in less time to go over logic.

column11: Questions are answered in detail and without judgement. Also really like solving questions visually, on the board - everything gets broken down really well
column12: Not anything specific that I can think of related to the module (I just don’t like logic)

column11: Communication an ability to ban a deeper understanding
column12: N/a

column11: I’d say that the overall knowledge portion of the module is quite interesting and maintains a constant level of overall difficulty which maintains engagement.
column12: Nothing really, sometimes the course load/course progression i.e how fast the module goes from topic to topic can be slightly overwhelming. However, this is the nature of uni in general and has very little to do with the seminar instructor who is very clear in his delivery and tries his best to ensure overall student understanding.

column11: Hugo has gone through each topic very carefully and is able to answer questions to good affect.
column12: Spending more time on the more difficult topic
column13: Hugo runs the seminar very well and teaches the content clearly and has helped me understand it

column11: Very engaging and well-explained especially during difficult topics.
Very good academical and teaching skills.
column12: None. Perfect

column11: I have been able to learn something new and feel mostly comfortable with the topics covered even though I did not have any prior knowledge of the topics. The seminars are helpful to consolidate my learning.
column12: I felt like there were some topics that were rushed and I found it difficult to catch up sometimes.

column11: I've found the seminars really useful in terms of consolidating the lecture material and clarifying any questions.
column12: I think the natural deducation week should be two weeks just because it's a hard topic so I think two weeks would mean that it isn't rushed as much.
column13: The seminars have generally been really useful and a good environment.

column11: Very meaningful seminars, well explained and helpful and incredibly well prepared
column12: slight miscommunication between seminar leader and lecturer. Not really the fault of Hugo though.

column11: The class discussions have been engaging, and the teacher is very interested in what he's doing.
column12: The module in general has been very hard for me personally, but the teacher has made it a bit easier for me in understanding the topic.
column13: Nope - recommend Mr Heagren for anyone and everyone interested in logic!
